sentences.en: A tide of emotion rose and clouded his judgement.
sentences.cn: 心头涌起一阵强烈的感情，模糊了他的判断力。

sentences.en: Displays of emotion are regarded with suspicion.
sentences.cn: 情感的流露会招致猜疑。

sentences.en: Happiness was an emotion that Reynolds was having to relearn.
sentences.cn: 雷诺兹已经不知道什么是快乐。

sentences.en: Her voice breaking with emotion, she told him: "It doesn't seem fair".
sentences.cn: 她激动得声音颤抖，对他说：“这好像不公平吧。”

sentences.en: Her voice was full of emotion.
Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.cn: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

sentences.en: Most of those attending the funeral stood silently showing little emotion.
sentences.cn: 出席葬礼的人大多都面无表情地静静站着。

sentences.en: She felt she was being dragged into a whirlpool of emotion.
sentences.cn: 她觉得自己被卷入了感情的旋涡。

sentences.en: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.cn: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.en: She was so overcome with emotion that she couldn't go on.
the exaltation of emotion above logical reasoning
sentences.cn: 把情感提高到逻辑推理之上

sentences.en: The patriot's voice trembled from the fervo ( u ) r of his emotion.
sentences.cn: 这位爱国者由于感情 激昂 而声音发抖.

sentences.en: The stadium was a seething cauldron of emotion.
They were caught up in a whirling vortex of emotion.
True emotion ought not to require overstatement.
sentences.cn: 真实的感情不应当需要过分渲染。

sentences.en: When we feel anger, we bury the emotion and feel guilty instead.
sentences.cn: 当我们感到愤怒时，压抑这种情绪反而会觉得内疚。
